remarks: Split a group sum into two parts.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 19-Dec-2014.)  Obsolete version of ~ gsumsplit2 as of 5-Jun-2019. (New usage is discouraged.)  (Proof modification is discouraged.)
statement:
gsumsplit2OLD.b $e |- B = ( Base ` G ) $.
gsumsplit2OLD.z $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` G ) $.
gsumsplit2OLD.p $e |- .+ = ( +g ` G ) $.
gsumsplit2OLD.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. CMnd ) $.
gsumsplit2OLD.a $e |- ( ph -> A e. V ) $.
gsumsplit2OLD.f $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. A ) -> X e. B ) $.
gsumsplit2OLD.w $e |- ( ph -> ( `' ( k e. A |-> X ) " ( _V \ { .0. } ) ) e. Fin ) $.
gsumsplit2OLD.i $e |- ( ph -> ( C i^i D ) = (/) ) $.
gsumsplit2OLD.u $e |- ( ph -> A = ( C u. D ) ) $.
gsumsplit2OLD $p |- ( ph -> ( G gsum ( k e. A |-> X ) ) = ( ( G gsum ( k e. C |-> X ) ) .+ ( G gsum ( k e. D |-> X ) ) ) ) $.
$d A k $.
$d B k $.
$d C k $.
$d D k $.
$d k ph $.
